info.description: This is not the ProductOrder API but the API to manage notification for ProductOrder. This API must be deployed on notification subscriber side (buyer side / listener).
info.title: API ProductOrderNotification

tags.name: Notification
tags.description: Notification class is used to describe structure used for product order notification (product order created, product order state change, product order information required, product order attribute value change)

ProductActionType.description: An enumeration of valid order item actions

ProductOrderStateType.description: An enumeration of valid order states

RelationshipType.description: Indicates the type of relationship between products.

ProductOrderItemStateType.description: An enumeration of valid order item states.

code.description: Application related code (as defined in the API or from a common list)

reason.description: Text that explains the reason for error. This can be shown to a client user.

message.description: Text that provide more details and corrective actions related to the error. This can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: url pointing to documentation describing the error

@type.description: The class type of a REST resource.

@schemaLocation.description: it provides a link to the schema describing a REST resource.

BillingAccountRef.description: An arrangement that a customer has with an enterprise that provides products to the customer.

id.description:
Identifies the buyer's billing account to which the recurring and non-recurring charges for this order item will be billed.
If the value 'NEW' is provided it means that buyer request a new BAN.

Note.description: A note, or set of notes, to be associated to the product order.

date.description: The date of the note. Format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD (e.g. 1997-07-16T19:20+01:00).

RelatedParty.description: An entity or organization that is involved in the product order, such as the buyer, the seller, the order contact, etc.

id.description: An identifier of the related party. For the "buyer" and "seller" id, this is a  Carrier ID number provided by local regulatory entity.  Unique in the local jurisdiction.

role.description: MEF: could be "Buyer", "Seller", "Billing Contact", "Order Contact", "Implementation Contact", "Technical Contact", "UNI Site Contact", "UNI Alt Site Contact", "ENNI Site Contact", "ENNI Alt Site Contact"

name.description: The name of the related party, e.g. "Jean Pontus".

emailAddress.description: The email address of the related party.

number.description: The telephone number of the related party.

ProductSpecification.description: A ProductSpec describes the invariant properties (i.e., features) that a given set of Products MAY have. These properties provide the information needed to plan, construct, allocate, and/or retire the Services and Resources from the operator environment needed to deliver the Product

id.description: A unique identifier for the product spec, within the product spec domain. It is assigned by the seller and communicated to the buyer at on-boarding time.

OrderMessage.description: An optional array of messages associated with the Order

code.description: The code associated with the Message

field.description: The field/attribute on the Order associated with message

messageInformation.description: A description of the error condition or information to be conveyed to the Buyer

correctionRequired.description: Indicates whether the Buyer must submit an updated Order to resolve the Error/Jeopardy condition.

Notification.description: This class is created only to gather Notification data structure. This structure must be send to the callback url provided in the HUB resource.

id.description: Unique (within the ordering domain) identifier for the order that is generated by the seller when the order is initially accepted.

externalId.description: A number that uniquely identifies an order within the buyer's enterprise.

requestedStartDate.description: The buyer's requested date that order processing should start. Format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD (e.g. 1997-07-16T19:20+01:00).

requestedCompletionDate.description: Identifies the buyer's desired due date (requested delivery date). Cannot be requested on cancelled orders.  Format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD (e.g. 1997-07-16T19:20+01:00).

expectedCompletionDate.description: Expected delivery date amended by the provider

completionDate.description: The date the order is completed. Format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD (e.g. 1997-07-16T19:20+01:00)

orderVersion.description: The version number that the Buyer uses to refer to this particular version of the order

projectId.description: An identifier that is used to group Orders that represent a unit of functionality that is important to a Buyer.  A Project can be used to relate multiple Orders together.

id.description: Identifier of the line item (generally it is a sequence number 01, 02, 03, ...)

@schemaLocation.description: Target a description file of productOrder extension

id.description: Unique (within the product domain) identifier for the product that is generated by the seller when the product is instantiated.

Event.description: Event class is used to describe information structure used for notification.
